description: Fols. 31; 15.7 x 11.6 cm.; written surface 11 x 8.4 cm.; 13 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; with vowel signs; with illumination. A fragment of a work on the description of Jerusalem together with a history of events that took place there. Beg.: بسم الله ... قال شىخ الامة ... الحمد لله خالق السموات والارض ومشرف بعض البقاع على بعض Ending: هو منکر الحدىث لم ىروه عن عبد الله بن بشر Title page illuminated in gold and color. On 43 folios following last is a fragment of a collection of correspondence in verse and prose. MS in fair condition; stained with dampness; several folios foxed; Arabic cloth binding. Probably from XlVth century. Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.
author: Ibn al-Jawzī, Abū al-Faraj ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAlī, 1116 (ca.)-1201
title: Faḍāʼil al-Quds
creator: Ibn al-Jawzī, Abū al-Faraj ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAlī, 1116 (ca.)-1201
subject: Jerusalem—Description and travel—Early works to 1800
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
